tier_1_determinative.attempt_to_extract_cash: The appellant attempted to snatch a gold chain from Narayan Jadhav.
tier_1_determinative.threat_to_kill: The appellant slit the throats of both Narayan Jadhav and Lata Jadhav with a knife during the robbery.
tier_1_determinative.weapon_used: A knife was used by the appellant to inflict injuries on the victims.
tier_1_determinative.injury_detail: Narayan Jadhav suffered a contusion lacerated wound over the neck of size 14 x 5 x 3 cm and another of size 15 x 5 x 3 cm, exposing the laryngeal cartilage and thyroid gland. Lata Jadhav had contusion lacerated wounds on her neck of size 16 x 4 x 3 cm and 14 x 3 x 3 cm.
tier_1_determinative.actus_reus_description: The appellant entered the Jadhavs' house at night, demanded water, and then attacked them with a knife, causing grievous injuries and robbing them.

tier_2_material.number_of_perpetrators: One, the appellant Dablu Arun Vishwas.
tier_2_material.victim_identity: Narayan Jadhav and his wife Lata Jadhav.
tier_2_material.previous_similar_incident: There is no mention of previous similar incidents involving the accused in the provided text.
tier_2_material.medical_evidence: Medical evidence included testimonies from Dr. Dipanjali Deshpande and Dr. Nitin Kurde, who treated the victims' serious knife wounds at Sanjivini Hospital.
tier_2_material.identification_parade: There is no specific mention of an identification parade in the provided text.

tier_3_contextual.incident_date_time: The incident occurred on the night of 10th October 2014, around 10:45 p.m.
tier_3_contextual.incident_location: The incident took place at the residence of the Jadhavs in Virar.
tier_3_contextual.victim_activity_before_incident: The victims were at home. Before the incident, Lata Jadhav and her husband were interacting with the appellant regarding food orders.

tier_4_procedural.case_title: Dablu Arun Vishwas vs. The State of Maharashtra
tier_4_procedural.court_name: High Court of Judicature at Bombay
tier_4_procedural.sections_invoked: Sections 394, 397, and 452 of the Indian Penal Code

residual_details.additional_facts: The appellant was known to the victims as he worked at a nearby food stall. The appellant was convicted and sentenced to ten years of rigorous imprisonment for robbery and additional sentences for related charges.

template_label: Robbery or dacoity, with attempt to cause death or grievous hurt (IPC 397)
